abstract: The sale is part of BP’s previously announced plan to raise at least $10 billion to cover damage claims from the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
snippet: The sale is part of BP’s previously announced plan to raise at least $10 billion to cover damage claims from the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
lead_paragraph: The troubled oil giant BP announced Tuesday that it had agreed to sell $7 billion of onshore oil and gas assets in Texas, New Mexico, western Canada and Egypt to the Apache Corporation, Jad Mouawad of The New York Times reports.

headline.main: BP Sells $7 Billion in Assets to Apache
